https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/newsplus/harvard-graduate-school-of-design-members-receive-united-states-artists-fellowships/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@graph": [{"@type": "WebPage", "@id": "https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/newsplus/harvard-graduate-school-of-design-members-receive-united-states-artists-fellowships/", "url": "https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/newsplus/harvard-graduate-school-of-design-members-receive-united-states-artists-fellowships/", "name": "Harvard Graduate School of Design members receive United States Artists Fellowships &#8212; Harvard Gazette", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/#website"}, "primaryImageOfPage": {"@id": "https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/newsplus/harvard-graduate-school-of-design-members-receive-united-states-artists-fellowships/#primaryimage"}, "image": {"@id": "https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/newsplus/harvard-graduate-school-of-design-members-receive-united-states-artists-fellowships/#primaryimage"}, "thumbnailUrl": "https://news.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/101821_ArtLab_002.jpg", "datePublished": "2022-02-10T15:32:15+00:00", "breadcrumb": {"@id": "https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/newsplus/harvard-graduate-school-of-design-members-receive-united-states-artists-fellowships/#breadcrumb"}, "inLanguage": "en-US", "potentialAction": [{"@type": "ReadAction", "target": ["https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/newsplus/harvard-graduate-school-of-design-members-receive-united-states-artists-fellowships/"]}]}, {"@type": "ImageObject", "inLanguage": "en-US", "@id": "https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/newsplus/harvard-graduate-school-of-design-members-receive-united-states-artists-fellowships/#primaryimage", "url": "https://news.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/101821_ArtLab_002.jpg", "contentUrl": "https://news.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/101821_ArtLab_002.jpg", "width": 2500, "height": 1667, "caption": "Views of the installation of HUCA artist Jordan Weber's work outside of the ArtLab with the help of Cambridge Landscaping. Jordan Weber is a Des Moines based regenerative land sculptor and environmental activist who works at the cross section of social justice and environmental racism. Most recently, Jordan was commissioned by the Walker Art Center to create an urban farm in North Minneapolis called Prototype for poetry vs. rhetoric (deep roots), which acts as a counter tactic to industrial violence upon biodiverse lands and racially diverse communities. The project was produced in collaboration with North Minneapolis community members during the height of the George Floyd protests in late May 2020. He is currently in residence at the Pulitzer Arts Foundation and Washington University\u2019s Center for the Study of Race, Ethnicity, and Equity and Sam Fox School of Design and Visual Arts. Jordan\u2019s two-year project residency centers on social and environmental justice, incarceration, and healing, with a specific focus on the Close the Workhouse campaign\u2014a collaborative project that is dedicated to the closure of St. Louis\u2019 Medium Security Institute, known locally as the Workhouse.
